methods.label: extractParam
methods.comment: Extracts a parameter to a specific index of SamsaraParamVals, using a ConverterParam and list of converters.
methods.codesample:
%REM
The following code is from JsonSetterConverter.loadParamValuesForJsonObject.
Loops through Me.params and constructs a corresponding Variant array of values. If the currParam&apos;s label exists in the parent JSON object (source), it is extracted. If a converter exists for that label, it will be used from the converters array. If the currParam&apos;s label does not exist in the parent JSON object, the currParam&apos;s default will be used instead.
%END REM
Dim currParam as CoverterParam
Dim i as Integer
For i = 0 to UBound(Me.params)
    Set currParam = Me.params(i)
    Select Case currParam.paramType
    Case &quot;Parent&quot;:
        Call extractParam(source, i, currParam, converters)
    End Select
Next

If the currParam&apos;s label does not exist in the parent JSON object, the currParam&apos;s default will be used instead.&lt;br /&gt;%END REM&lt;br /&gt;Dim currParam as CoverterParam&lt;br /&gt;Dim i as Integer&lt;br /&gt;For i = 0 to UBound(Me.params)&lt;br /&gt;    Set currParam = Me.params(i)&lt;br /&gt;    Select Case currParam.paramType&lt;br /&gt;    Case &quot;Parent&quot;:&lt;br /&gt;        Call extractParam(source, i, currParam, converters)&lt;br /&gt;    End Select&lt;br /&gt;Next

classes.comment: Class to hold details from which to extract a parameter for a setter or constructor.
classes.codesample:
%REM
Adds a ConverterParam to retrieve an element from the current JSON object for the labelName passed, falling back to a defaultValue passed.
This is an abbreviated version of code in JsonCustomConstructor.withParam
%END REM
Function withParam(labelName as String, defaultValue as Variant) as JsonCustomConstructor
    Call redimParams()
    Set Me.params(UBound(params)) = new ConverterParam(&quot;JSON&quot;, labelName, defaultValue)
    Return Me
End Function

methods.label: cleanup
methods.comment: Resets globals
methods.codesample:
%REM
Runs an execute statement, which needs global variables to store the value and the object from which to extract it. Whether successful or unsoccessful, the Finally block&apos;s call to cleanup() sub re-initialises samsaraObj, samsaraVal and samsaraParamVals to empty variants.
%END REM
Try
    execString = |samsaraVal = samsaraObj.| & propName
    Execute(execString)
Catch
    Error 1400, &quot;Unable to set &quot; & labelName & &quot; to extracted value&quot;
Finally
    Call Me.cleanup()
End Try
methods.signature: Sub cleanup()
methods.commentblock: &lt;div class=&quot;description&quot;&gt;	&lt;ul class=&quot;blockList&quot;&gt;		&lt;li class=&quot;blockList&quot;&gt;			&lt;div class=&quot;comments&quot;&gt;&lt;!-- comment --&gt;&lt;pre&gt;Resets globals&lt;/pre&gt;&lt;/div&gt;			&lt;hr /&gt;		&lt;/li&gt;	&lt;/ul&gt;&lt;/div&gt;
methods.commenthtml: Resets globals
methods.codesamplehtml: %REM&lt;br /&gt;Runs an execute statement, which needs global variables to store the value and the object from which to extract it. Whether successful or unsoccessful, the Finally block&apos;s call to cleanup() sub re-initialises samsaraObj, samsaraVal and samsaraParamVals to empty variants.&lt;br /&gt;%END REM&lt;br /&gt;Try&lt;br /&gt;    execString = |samsaraVal = samsaraObj.| & propName&lt;br /&gt;    Execute(execString)&lt;br /&gt;Catch&lt;br /&gt;    Error 1400, &quot;Unable to set &quot; & labelName & &quot; to extracted value&quot;&lt;br /&gt;Finally&lt;br /&gt;    Call Me.cleanup()&lt;br /&gt;End Try

methods.label: isReturnObj
methods.comment:
Whether or not the converter returns a VoltScript object or VoltScript scalar or scalar array.
This function is used to determine whether &quot;Set&quot; needs to be used to write the result to a variable.
Default version of the function returns True.
methods.codesample:
%REM
A converter is expected to know whether it should return a scalar or a VoltScript object. The default is false, that it only returns scalars. This function is used to determine whether or not there is a need to call Set. In future versions, where Return is implemented in functions, this may no longer be required.
%END REM
Dim returnVal as Variant
If Me.isReturnObj Then
    Set returnVal = Me.fromJson(jsonObj)
Else
    returnVal = Me.fromJson(jsonObj)
End If
methods.signature: Function isReturnObj() As Boolean
methods.commentblock: &lt;div class=&quot;description&quot;&gt;	&lt;ul class=&quot;blockList&quot;&gt;		&lt;li class=&quot;blockList&quot;&gt;			&lt;div class=&quot;comments&quot;&gt;&lt;!-- comment --&gt;&lt;pre&gt;Whether or not the converter returns a VoltScript object or VoltScript scalar or scalar array.&lt;br /&gt;This function is used to determine whether &quot;Set&quot; needs to be used to write the result to a variable.&lt;br /&gt;Default version of the function returns True.&lt;/pre&gt;&lt;/div&gt;			&lt;hr /&gt;		&lt;/li&gt;	&lt;/ul&gt;&lt;/div&gt;

methods.label: forPropertyName
methods.comment:
Defines a custom property name from the relevant Class to use.
If not used, the code will look for a property that matches the label in the JSON
methods.codesample:
%REM
Ensures that when the surnameConverter extracts its value, it writes it to the lastName property of the target VoltScript object.

    toObject(source, &quot;Pet&quot;, &quot;deser-80&quot;)._

methods.label: withContext
methods.comment: Passes a JSON object from which to extract parameter values
methods.codesample:
%REM
If a constructor is defined for the JsonConversionHelper, it is used to create an instance of className as defined in a script file called libName, using as its context a JsonObject (source) and the current jsonConversionHelper&apos;s list of converters.
The code is an abbreviated version of code in JsonConversionHelper.toObject().
%END REM
If Not Me.constructor is Nothing Then
    SetMe. mainHolder.contents = Me.constructor.withContext(source, Me.converters).createObject(className, libName)
End If

methods.label: withParam
methods.comment: Fluent method to retrieve a parameter value for the constructor from the JSON object or a default value to use if the label is not in the JSON object.
methods.codesample:
%REM
The code below calls the Session class&apos;s New method passing two parameters, the JSON object&apos;s &quot;id&quot; and &quot;title&quot; elements, in that order.
The code can be found in the deser-70.txt example.
%END REM
Dim sess as Session
Dim helper as New JsonConversionHelper
Dim sessionConstructor as New JsonCustomConstructor
Dim json as String
  
json = |{&quot;id&quot;:&quot;Ad01&quot;,&quot;title&quot;:&quot;Domino HA&quot;}|
Call sessionConstructor.withParam(&quot;id&quot;, &quot;&quot;).withTitle(&quot;title&quot;, &quot;&quot;)
Set sess = helper.withCustomConstructor(sessionConstructor).fromJsonString(json, &quot;Session&quot;, &quot;deser-70&quot;)

methods.label: withCustomConverter
methods.comment: Passes a custom converter to this JsonArrayConverter. The converter will be used to convert each element in the array to a VoltScript object rather than a scalar or scalar array.
methods.codesample:
%REM
Converts a JSON object with an array of dates, converting each element in the array to a ZuluLSX DateTimeObject. The arrayConverter is mapped to the &quot;modified&quot; property of the JSON object, but the dateConverter just needs to run on each element in the array. So a label to look for does not need to be passed.
%END REM
Dim dateConverter as New ZuluDateTimeSerializer()
Dim arrayConverter as new JsonArrayConverter()
Dim helper as New JsonConversionHelper
Dim jsonString as String
Dim obj as ObjectSummary
jsonString = |{&quot;unid&quot;:&quot;12345678901234567890123456789012&quot;,&quot;modified&quot;:[&quot;2023-02-01T13:00:00Z&quot;,&quot;2023-02-01T13:15:12Z&quot;,&quot;2023-02-02T09:00:00Z&quot;]}|
Call helper.withCustomConverter(&quot;modified&quot;, arrayConverter.withCustomConverter(dateConverter))
Set obj = helper.fromJsonString(jsonString, &quot;ObjectSummary&quot;, &quot;ObjectClass&quot;)
methods.signature: Function withCustomConverter(converter As AbstractJsonConverter) As JsonArrayConverter

The converter will be used to convert each element in the array to a VoltScript object rather than a scalar or scalar array.&lt;/pre&gt;&lt;/div&gt;			&lt;hr /&gt;		&lt;/li&gt;	&lt;/ul&gt;&lt;/div&gt;

methods.label: toJson
methods.comment: Overridden function. The toJson method is called from AbstractJsonConverter&apos;s serialize method.
methods.codesample:
%REM
The following code is an abbreviated version of code in AbstractJsonConverter.serialize. It extracts a property value, passes it to the derived class&apos;s toJson function and passes the result to AbstractJsonConverter.serializeToProperty
%END REM
Sub serialize(source as Variant, target as JsonObject)
    Dim propName as String
    Dim execString as String
    propName = Me.labelName
    Set samsaraObj = source
    execString = |If (isObject(samsaraObj.| & propName & |)) Then
        Set samsaraVal = samsaraObj.| & propName & |
    Else
        samsaraVal = samsaraObj.| & propName & |
    End If|
    Call serializeToProperty(toJson(samsaraVal), target)
End Sub

%REM
The following code is abbreviated code from ComplexPersonTest. It creates a JsonConversionHelper to convert &quot;name&quot; and &quot;type&quot; properties as scalars and passes it to a JsonBasicObjectArrayConverter. Unlike the JsonBasicObjectConverter example, this converts a Variant array of pets.
The population of the Person object is omitted here, but it is generated from the following JSON
{&quot;firstName&quot;:&quot;Paul&quot;,&quot;lastName&quot;:&quot;Withers&quot;,&quot;pets&quot;: [{&quot;name&quot;:&quot;Peter&quot;,&quot;type&quot;:&quot;Guinea Pig&quot;},{&quot;name&quot;:&quot;Benjamin&quot;,&quot;type&quot;:&quot;Guinea Pig&quot;}]}
%END REM
Dim helper as New JsonConversionHelper()
Dim petConverter as New JsonBasicObjectConverter(&quot;Pet&quot;, &quot;ComplexPersonTest&quot;)
Dim person as Person
Dim jsonObj as JsonObject
Dim petHelper as New JsonConversionHelper()
Call helper.withScalarConverter(&quot;name&quot;).withScalarConverter(&quot;type&quot;)
Call petConverter.withHelper(petHelper.withScalarConverter(&quot;name&quot;).withScalarConverter(&quot;type&quot;))
Call helper.withCustomConverter(&quot;pets&quot;, petConverter)
Set jsonObj = helper.toJson(person)

methods.label: enableDebug
methods.comment: Enables debug printing, switched off by default.
methods.codesample:
%REM
Enables debug for the duration of converting a string of JSON to a Person, then disables debug again. The use case for this would be that deserialization is not working, so the developer is trying to trace progress to see where it is failing.
%END REM
Dim helper as New JsonConversionHelper
Call helper.enableDebug()
Call helper.fromJsonString(json, &quot;Person&quot;, &quot;PersonClass&quot;)
Call helper.disableDebug()

methods.label: failSilently
methods.comment: Prevents throwing errors if deserialization / serialization fails, instead just aborts settings the properties.
methods.codesample:
%REM
This code converts a string of JSON to a Person object, ignoring any labels that do not have corresponding properties or incorrect data types.
%END REM
Dim json as String
Dim person as Person
Dim helper as New JsonConversionHelper()
json = |{&quot;firstName&quot;:&quot;John&quot;,&quot;lastName&quot;:&quot;Doe&quot;,&quot;age&quot;: 42, &quot;gender&quot;: &quot;M&quot;}|
Call helper.failSilently()
Set person = helper.fromJsonString(json, &quot;Person&quot;, &quot;PersonClass&quot;)

Call helper.ignoreLabel(&quot;ipaddress&quot;)

%REM

Dim jd as Person
json = |{&quot;firstName&quot;:&quot;John&quot;,&quot;lastName&quot;:&quot;Doe&quot;,&quot;age&quot;:42,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;M&quot;}|
Set jd = helper.ignoreLabel(&quot;gender&quot;).fromJsonString(json, &quot;Person&quot;, &quot;PersonClass&quot;)
Print helper.shouldIgnoreLabel(&quot;gender&quot;)
Print helper.shouldIgnoreLabel(&quot;firstName&quot;)

methods.label: reset
methods.comment: Resets the holder object containing the return value. This allows you to re-use the helper.
methods.codesample:
%REM
Uses a helper to deserialize JSON to a Person object, then resets it so it can be re-used by subsequent code. The mainHolder property will be re-initialized, but all converters or labels to ignore will still exist in the helper. So subsequent calls will also ignore &quot;gender&quot; label.
%END REM
Dim json as String
Dim helper as New JsonConversionHelper()
Dim jd as Person
json = |{&quot;firstName&quot;:&quot;John&quot;,&quot;lastName&quot;:&quot;Doe&quot;,&quot;age&quot;:42,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;M&quot;}|
Set jd = helper.ignoreLabel(&quot;gender&quot;).fromJsonString(json, &quot;Person&quot;, &quot;PersonClass&quot;)
Call helper.reset()

methods.label: getCustomConverter
methods.comment: Returns the custom converter for a label, if it exists.
methods.codesample:
%REM
The code is an abbreviated version of code found in JsonConversionHelper.fromJson(). For a given JSON object (child) gets a converter based on the JSON object&apos;s label (elemName) and, if the converter exists, calls its deserialize method to convert the JSON object into mainHolder.
%END REM
Dim converter as AbstractJsonConverter
Dim elemName as String
elemName = child.label
Set converter = Me.getCustomConverter(elemName)
If Not converter is Nothing Then
    converter.deserialize(Me.mainHolder, child)
End If

The code can be found in the deser-70.txt example.

Dim sess as Session

methods.codesample:
%REM
The following code is from ser-20.txt sample 1. Converts a Session object to a String, outputting &quot;id&quot; and &quot;title&quot; as strings, and using an arrayConverter to convert the &quot;products&quot; property of the Session (a Variant array) to a JSON array.
%END REM
Dim sess as New Session
Dim json as String
Dim helper as New JsonConversionHelper
sess.id = &quot;Ad16&quot;
sess.title = &quot;Collaborate around Business Applications in Communities&quot;
sess.products = Split(&quot;Domino,Connections,Volt&quot;, &quot;,&quot;)
Call helper.withScalarConverter(&quot;id&quot;).withScalarConverter(&quot;title&quot;).withArrayConverter(&quot;products&quot;)
json = helper.toJsonString(sess, true)

%REM

Dim parser as New JsonParser
Dim obj as JsonObject
Dim helper as New JsonConversionHelper
Dim arr as Variant
Call parser.loadFromJson(|{&quot;success&quot;: true, &quot;data&quot;: [{&quot;firstName&quot;:&quot;John&quot;,&quot;lastName&quot;:&quot;Doe&quot;,&quot;age&quot;:42},{&quot;firstName&quot;:&quot;Jane&quot;,&quot;lastName&quot;:&quot;Doe&quot;,&quot;age&quot;:30}]}|)
Set obj = parser.getRootObject().getChild(&quot;data&quot;)
arr = helper.jsonArrayToObjects(obj, &quot;Person&quot;, &quot;PersonClass&quot;)

methods.label: serialize
methods.comment: Overridden function
methods.codesample:
%REM
Converters are required for every property to be serialized to JSON, because we cannot use reflection to know what properties exist. So this code loops through all converters in the JsonConversionHelper and call their serialize method, which populates the JSON object from the global SamsaraObj, which has already been populated with a VoltScript object (e.g. an instance of a Person class).
The code is an abbreviated version of code in JsonConversionHelper.processObjectToJson()
%END REM
Dim returnObj as New JsonObject()
ForAll converters in Me.converters
    Call converter.serialize(samsaraObj, returnObj)
End ForAll

classes.comment: Custom Converter to convert between a JSON value or values and VoltScript datatype or objects, using a specific sub or function in the underlying class. During deserialization, the relevant JSON objects will then be removed from the parent JSON object, to ensure they are not re-processed.
classes.codesample:
%REM
The following code is in sample1 of deser-50.txt. When processing the firstName label in the JSON object, the JsonSetterConverter will be used to call the setName sub, passing the current value (the first name) as the first parameter and the lastName, a sibling of the firstName element in the JSON object, as the second parameter.
%END REM
Dim jsonObj as JsonObject  &apos;populate accordingly
Dim converter as New JsonSetterConverter
Dim mainHolder as New Person()
Call converter.forSetter(&quot;setName&quot;).withValueParam().withSiblingParam(&quot;lastName&quot;)
Dim helper as New JsonConversionHelper()
Call helper.withCustomConverter(&quot;firstName&quot;, converter)
Call converter.deserialize(mainHolder, jsonObj)

methods.label: withValueParam
methods.comment:
Uses the scalar value of the JSON element the converter is associated with.
The value will be added to the end of the params array, as the nth parameter to pass to the relevant setter.
methods.codesample:
%REM
The following code is from deser-50.txt. It deserializes a JSON object that contains firstName and lastName properties. During the deserialization it calls Laureate.setName(firstName as String, lastName as String). To do this, it uses a JsonSetterConverter tied to the firstName property, so withValueParam picks up that property.
%END REM
Dim json as String
Dim helper as new JsonConversionHelper()
Dim setterConverter as New JsonSetterConverter()
Dim json as |{&quot;firstname&quot;:&quot;Guglielmo&quot;, &quot;surname&quot;:&quot;Marconi&quot;, &quot;share&quot;: 2}|
Call setterConverter.forSetter(&quot;setName&quot;)._
    withValueParam()._
    withSiblingParam(&quot;surname&quot;, &quot;&quot;)
Call helper.withCustomCnverter(&quot;firstName&quot;, setterConverter)

json = helper.withScalarConverter(&quot;firstName&quot;)._
    withScalarConverter(&quot;lastName&quot;)._
    withScalarConverter(&quot;age&quot;)
    toJsonString(jd, false)

methods.label: toJson
methods.comment: Overridden function. The toJson method is called from AbstractJsonConverter&apos;s serialize method.
methods.codesample:
%REM
The following code is an abbreviated version of code in AbstractJsonConverter.serialize. It extracts a property value, passes it to the derived class&apos;s toJson function and passes the result to AbstractJsonConverter.serializeToProperty
%END REM
Sub serialize(source as Variant, target as JsonObject)
    Dim propName as String
    Dim execString as String
    propName = Me.labelName
    Set samsaraObj = source
    execString = |If (isObject(samsaraObj.| & propName & |)) Then
        Set samsaraVal = samsaraObj.| & propName & |
    Else
        samsaraVal = samsaraObj.| & propName & |
    End If|
    Call serializeToProperty(toJson(samsaraVal), target)
End Sub
